skills.name: Construct a pictogram involving fractions of symbols
Interpret a pictogram involving fractions of symbols
Solve comparison, sum and difference problems using information presented in pictograms

explanations.A: Not quite, that would be 3 whole faces but we only have 2 whole faces and 3 quarters of a face. What is 3 quarters of 8?
explanations.B: I think you have found the number of people who went to game 2. We have 2 full faces and 3 quarters of a face. What is 3 quarters of 8?
explanations.C: This is how many symbols we have, but how many people does that equal if each symbol is worth 8 people?
explanations.D: There are 2 whole faces so we have 2 × 8 = 16. We also have 3 quarters of a face which is 3 quarters of 8 which equals 6. 16 + 6 = 22

explanations.A: I think you have found the number of people who went to game 3. We have 3 full faces and 3 quarters of a face. What is 3 quarters of 8?
explanations.B: There are 3 whole faces so we have 3 × 8 = 24. We also have 3 quarters of a face which is 3 quarters of 8 which equals 6. 24 + 6 = 30
explanations.C: This is how many symbols we have, but how many people does that equal if each symbol is worth 8 people?
explanations.D: I think you have found the number of people who went to game 1. We have 3 full faces and 3 quarters of a face. What is 3 quarters of 8?

explanations.A: Dairy milk has the most faces with 3 and a half, so this is the favourite.
explanations.B: I think you chose Galaxy as the symbols finish furthest across the chart. Make sure you count the number of symbols to see which has the most
explanations.C: Not quite. There are other chocolates that have more symbols in, so are more popular
explanations.D: Not quite. Make sure you count the number of symbols to see which has the most, this is the favourite

explanations.A: Not quite, this is the least favourite. We want the chocolate with the most symbols
explanations.B: Galaxy has 3 and a quarter symbols which is more than any other chocolate. It is therefore the favourite
explanations.C: I think you chose Nestle as the symbols finish furthest across the chart. Make sure you count the number of symbols to see which has the most
explanations.D: Not quite. Make sure you count the number of symbols to see which has the most, this is the favourite

explanations.A: There is no question asked as a title.
explanations.B: Not quite. Would you know what this pictogram is telling you? What would need to be added?
explanations.C: Not quite, we do have a key
explanations.D: Not quite, we can use an 'other' option to cover everything else and we don't need to say exactly what flavours were chosen

explanations.A: Not quite. The question they asked is given.
explanations.B: Not quite. Would you know how many people chose each option? What is needed for that?
explanations.C: There is no key to tell us what each face is worth.
explanations.D: Not quite, we can use an 'other' option to cover everything else and we don't need to say exactly what flavours were chosen

explanations.A: I think you have assumed each tree symbol represents 10 trees. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees. Recalculate your answer.
explanations.B: I think you have counted the tree symbols. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees. Recalculate your answer.
explanations.C: I think you have counted the half tree as 0.5. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees, so how many would half a tree represent? Recalculate your answer.
explanations.D: One tree symbol represents 20 trees. So 7.5 x 20 = 150 trees in total for Ash

explanations.A: I think you have assumed each tree symbol represents 10 trees. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees. Recalculate your answer.
explanations.B: I think you have counted the tree symbols. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees. Recalculate your answer.
explanations.C: One tree symbol represents 20 trees. So 5.5 x 20 = 110 trees in total for Elm
explanations.D: I think you have counted the half tree as 0.5. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees, so how many would half a tree represent? Recalculate your answer.

explanations.A: I think you have assumed that you would need one tree symbol per tree. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees. Recalculate your answer.
explanations.B: I think you have assumed that one tree symbol would represent 10 trees. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees. Recalculate your answer.
explanations.C: One tree symbol would represent 20 trees. 50/20 = 2.5
explanations.D: I think you have assumed that one tree symbol would represent 5 trees. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees. Recalculate your answer.

explanations.B: I think you have assumed that one tree symbol would represent 5 trees. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees. Recalculate your answer.

explanations.D: I think you have assumed that one tree symbol would represent 10 trees. The key says that one tree symbol represents 20 trees. Recalculate your answer.
